image.altText: A woman with sunglasses on outside court next to a camera operator

props.synopsis: Raelene Polymiadis, who allegedly murdered her elderly parents by injecting them with her prescription insulin, admits to breaching bail by attending a shopping centre in Adelaide's north in December 2023.

title.children: Murder-accused Raelene Polymiadis admits to shopping centre bail breach

image.altText: Jason Hagon is wearing a suit but no tie and walking next to a female reporter

props.synopsis: Jason Paul Hagon's six-year jail term for indecently assaulting nine female clients at his home-based business has been reduced by eight months on appeal.

title.children: Massage therapist's jail term for indecently assaulting clients reduced

image.altText: Fatal stabbing victim William Holdback.

props.synopsis: The mother of William Holdback, who was fatally stabbed on a suburban Adelaide street almost a year ago, has expressed her devastation as the two men charged with his murder enter not guilty pleas in court.

title.children: 'Worst nightmare': mother's grief as accused men deny murder charge

image.altText: A woman holds a small black and white dog

props.synopsis: Laws introduced last year aim to make it easier for tenants to have pets in private rentals in South Australia. But some say it's making little difference on the ground, as renters continue to face high levels of competition amid an ongoing housing crisis.

title.children: Concerns renters with pets are still being rejected, despite law reform

image.altText: Lisa Cunningham

props.synopsis: An Australian woman awaiting trial over the death of her stepdaughter is unable to leave jail because her bail has been set at a "terribly unfair" $US500,000, according to her lawyer.Â

title.children: SA woman awaiting trial over stepdaughter's death can't post bail, lawyer says

image.altText: A woman with blonde hair wearing a green shirt smiling in front of rolled up carpet

props.synopsis: The South Australian was turning off a light and heading to bed when lightning struck her house and sent a bolt through her arm.

title.children: Woman struck by lightning while turning off light in her home

image.altText: Ashley McGregor has a blonde beard and is wearing a blue stripy polo shirt and a baseball cap

props.synopsis: A father has been found guilty of the manslaughter and criminal neglect of his 21-day-old son, who sustained injuries consistent with a high-impact car crash.

title.children: Father guilty of killing baby son whose injuries were like car crash victim's

image.altText: cracked dry soil surrounded by dry shrub

props.synopsis: An invisible disaster is unfolding in South Australia, and those impacted want a future plan to make sure they have enough water to survive, writes Meagan Dillon.Â

title.children: 'Water is a basic need': An invisible disaster is unfolding in South Australia

image.altText: Staff follow Mathew Hawkins outside the hotel moments before he punches Luke Sweetman

title.children: Final moments of 'fun-loving' man killed in one-punch attack released by court

image.altText: An x-ray of a baby who swallowed a button battery.

props.synopsis: Baby AdÃ¨le is now on the road to recovery, but two months ago she was in intensive care after swallowing a button battery, leaving her parents completely petrified and fearing "she might not make it".

title.children: Button battery nightmare prompts parents to keep technology sealed

image.altText: A man lays on the ground with a tree branch strewn across a driveway surrounded by emergency services personnel

props.synopsis: An Adelaide couple has escaped serious injuries after they were hit by a falling tree branch in their driveway on Tuesday â a day after a festival-goer was taken to hospital when a branch fell during WOMAD. Warning: This story contains graphic images.

title.children: Adelaide couple injured in second falling tree branch incident this week

image.altText: A woman in a headscarf sitting under a tree.

props.synopsis: A newly-opened multi-million-dollar apartment complex in Adelaide's CBD will help women like Kiran escape from violent relationships.

title.children: Affordable apartments to help family violence survivors 'rebuild their lives'

image.altText: Outside the Broken Hill Correctional Centre

props.synopsis: A 28-year-old man who allegedly escaped from a Broken Hill prison has been recaptured following a two-day manhunt. A second alleged escapee is back in custody, and the two have been given additional charges.

title.children: Second alleged prison escapee recaptured in Broken Hill

image.altText: A night scene of a tree branch fallen on the ground, with lights strung up behind

props.synopsis: Two people were injured â and one was taken to hospital â when a tree branch fell in Botanic Park during the WOMADelaide festival on Monday. Emergency services are urging people to take care near heat stressed trees after a hot summer.

title.children: Two injured in 'awful, tragic' tree branch fall during WOMADelaide

image.altText: A woman holding a nail gun on a construction site

props.synopsis: As Australia's construction industry continues to suffer from a worker shortage, some female tradies say more women want to take up the tools but are prevented by sexist attitudes on the job site.Â

title.children: Chippy loves her trade, but says sexist remarks are a barrier for women

image.altText: A prefab module for an apartment building.

props.synopsis:
Prefab housing has been touted as the answer to Australia's housing supply for years, but it's an industry plagued with high costs, low scale and a desperate need for investment if it's ever going to be a solution.

Â 

Â

title.children: Sweden builds houses in days, Australia tried to do that 50 years ago

image.altText: A cave diver wearing a yellow helmet, blue mask and black wetsuit squeezes between rocks.

props.synopsis: Curious divers on South Australia's Limestone Coast are hoping to one day be able to dive into one cave and come out another, after discovering an underground tunnel.Â

title.children: Cave divers' push to unexplored territory uncovers 100m tunnel

image.altText: An aerial view of a smouldering, burnt out container ship out at sea.

props.synopsis: Police arrested the captain of the Solong container ship on Tuesday on suspicion of gross negligence and manslaughter.

title.children: Cargo ship captain arrested after UK tanker crash is a Russian national

image.altText: A close-up of Donald Trump wearing a white shirt, blue suit jacket and yellow tie

props.synopsis: NASA has announced the dismissal of its chief scientist in its first round of cuts ordered by US President Donald Trump.

title.children: NASA loses chief scientist in first round of Trump-ordered cuts

image.altText: Rodrigo Duterte looks emotionlessly forward at the camera with short black hair

props.synopsis: The former Philippine president is expected to face a preliminary hearing in coming days.

title.children: Rodrigo Duterte lands in the Netherlands after 'war on drugs' arrest

image.altText: People carry garbage bags picking up rubbish on a beach.

props.synopsis: Queensland's bay islands act as a natural buffer protecting the mainland from severe storm surges, and helped save Brisbane from the full force of Cyclone Alfred.Â

title.children: The islands that saved millions from Cyclone Alfred

image.altText: A flat lay of a calculator, an electricity bill and a mobile phone displaying an ABC article about electricity prices.

props.synopsis: Power prices are set to rise yet again, with the energy market regulator lifting the benchmarks for how much retailers can charge for electricity.Â

title.children: Power prices to rise nearly 9 per cent for some from mid-year

image.altText: A man armed with a rifle wearing camouflage gear standing alongside a green and yellow passenger train carriage

props.synopsis: Pakistan authorities say the day-long stand off involving hundreds of hostages has ended.

title.children: Pakistan's army says 21 hostages dead after train siege ends

props.synopsis:
The Prime Minister has agreed insurance companies are ripping us off. So, how will they respond as tens of thousands of claims are lodged after flooding in the wake of ex-Cyclone Alfred?Â

title.children: ABC News Daily: Can we afford ârip offâ insurance after Alfred?

image.altText: Donald Trump standing in the Oval Office. To his left is Arthur Sinodinos and to his right, Arthur's wife Elizabeth.

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese may be under attack from the Coalition, but former ambassador Arthur Sinodinos knows Donald Trump and believes the PM has taken the right approach to US tariffs. Â

title.children: 'Eyeball' Trump: Former ambassador's advice for Australia's next PM

image.altText: A journalist wears sunglasses, helmet and a vest with a "press" badge as he carries a camera tripod on his left shoulder.

props.synopsis: Afghans who fled after the Taliban takeover were all set for new lives in the United States until Donald Trump signed an executive order pausing the refugee program, leaving people with approved visas and booked flights dreading a return to Taliban rule.

title.children: Afghans who helped America fight the Taliban could be sent back

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: Three people hugging in a crowd

props.synopsis: The centre-right Demokraatit Party has won the most votes in Greenland's parliamentary elections, a surprise result as the territory went to the polls in the shadow of US President Donald Trump's stated goal of taking control of the island one way or another.

title.children: Centre-right party wins Greenland's election as Trump seeks control

image.altText: Anti-Semitic graffiti sprayed on a white car parked in a driveway.

props.synopsis: The ABC can reveal that one of the 14 people arrested by detectives under Strike Force Pearl earlier this week is believed to have helped orchestrate five instances of antisemitic vandalism and arson during January.

title.children: Man police allege to be key figure in five Sydney antisemitic attacks revealed

image.altText: Damaged residential buildings after being hit with a missile

props.synopsis: Four civilians have been killed in a Ukrainian attack on Russia's western Kursk region, Russian officials say.

title.children: US arms flow to Ukraine again as Russia mulls ceasefire

image.altText: An aerial shot of a harbour.

props.synopsis: The Australian Maritime Safety Authority is investigating how the divers came to be left behind before being rescued by a passing ferry.

title.children: Two scuba divers left behind in ocean during dive trip

image.altText: A smiling, dark-haired man with a beard â actor Leonardo DiCaprio.

props.synopsis: The Oscar-winning actor is not happy with the federal energy minister for signing off on a bauxite mine expansion that would see 3,855 hectares of native forest cleared.

title.children: Leonardo DiCaprio slams Australian government over mine expansion

image.altText: A man driving a dingy.

props.synopsis: The family of Victorian Steven Payne, who was killed on WA's remote south coast, say he "loved his partner deeply, cherished his family, thought the world of his best mates, and was devoted to his dog".

title.children: Family of shark attack victim remember 'gentle giant' who wouldn't support cull

image.altText: Full moon in cloudy sky above Byron Bay lighthouses

props.synopsis: While America is set to see an incredible "blood moon" this week, only a fraction of Australians will see a sliver of the final moments of a partial lunar eclipse. Here's when and what to look for if you are one of the lucky ones.

title.children: Blood moon or missing sliver? What you may see from this week's eclipse
